page.title: 15LOCAL NEWS
page.content: LOOKING AT OUR LOCAL NEWS FOR THE WEEK 17-22 JUNE 1985 WE FOUND SOME GOOD NEWS ABOUT THE YOUTH OF TODAY.PAUL FOSTER, AGED 15,OF LEATHERHEAD AND NIGEL CRAIG, AGED 14,OF CHESSINGTON ATTEND FLEETWOOD SCHOOL,CHESSINGTON.THE TWO BOYS WON 450 POUNDS IN A COMPUTER COMPETITION.THE COMPETITION WAS RUN BY "BOOTS THE CHEMISTS" AND CONSISTED OF MAKING A GAMES PROGRAM WITH COLOUR,MUSIC AND GRAPHICS.IT TOOK 80 HOURS FOR THE BOYS TO COMPLETE.THE PRIZE WAS 350 POUNDS FOR THEIR SCHOOL AND 50 POUNDS EACH FOR THEIR OWN COMPUTERS. IT IS INTERESTING TO NOTE THAT,IN THE SAME WEEK,MALDEN MANOR SCHOOL(CLASS 10) VISITED FLEETWOOD SCHOOL'S COMPUTER ROOM AND HAD FUN PLAYING ALL THE GAMES ON THEIR 20 COMPUTERS.IT WAS ENJOYABLE TO VISIT A SECONDARY SCHOOL AND USE THEIR EQUIPMENT.
